hint: Push selective filters (date, category, state) early into dimension tables, convert implicit joins to explicit CTEs, and pre-filter fact tables to reduce join cardinality before aggregation.
Isolate date and dimension filters into separate CTEs, then restructure the multi-fact join with explicit JOIN syntax to improve predicate pushdown and reduce intermediate result sizes.
Materialize pre-filtered dimensions and facts into separate CTEs, then join them in a star-like pattern. Decompose the multi-fact self-join to avoid redundant scans and leverage indexed accesses.

Break the complex multi-fact join into independent subqueries using CTEs, then intersect or union results structurally. Transform implicit join conditions into explicit EXISTS or derived tables for better plan flexibility.
